> Tucson listens to Wheelie patiently although he had apprehensions reg=

as also the state of his temperament which indicated that he was starting t=
o show a somewhat short fuse.  He taps his fingers on the left hand as he s=
its Back in his chair with a bit of a hardened expression on his face. It w=
ould not be the first time he had lost his temper but it was clear that now=

> " Wheelie, that's enough.=
  When it comes time for us to go into battle we will."

peak you must first address me in an appropriate manner."

voice raises as he struggles to keep his temper under control.


Wheelie gl=
ancing up at Tuscon, "Appropriately you say, see nothing but a fool so stay=
 away!  He who says how he should be said, more often than not ends up shot=
 in the head!"

Wheelie skittering about the room, "Now, what I say may not=
